name: caffeine
mechanism: Adenosine receptor antagonist - blocks tiredness signals and increases alertness

name: l-theanine
mechanism: Increases alpha brain waves, promotes GABA, serotonin, and dopamine production

name: EGCG
mechanism: Powerful antioxidant, supports neuroplasticity and BDNF production

name: ECG
mechanism: Catechin with antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties

name: theaflavins
mechanism: Unique to black/pu-erh tea, crosses blood-brain barrier, neuroprotective

name: thearubigins
mechanism: Complex polymeric compounds in fermented teas, support gut-brain axis

name: theabrownins
mechanism: Unique to pu-erh, neuroprotective and anti-inflammatory

name: GABA
mechanism: Primary inhibitory neurotransmitter, promotes calm and reduces anxiety

name: theobromine
mechanism: Mild stimulant, smooth energy without jitters, vasodilator

name: polysaccharides
mechanism: Support gut health and immune function, anti-inflammatory

name: menthol
mechanism: Cooling sensation, mental clarity, digestive comfort

name: apigenin
mechanism: Binds to GABA receptors, promotes relaxation and sleep

name: lovastatin
mechanism: Naturally occurring statin in aged pu-erh, improves cerebral blood flow
